description.narrative: UNGEI's global leadership and advocacy through partnerships to support girls' education and gender equality coordinated, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Every Child to Learn By 2021, countries apply child-sensitive policies, innovative community-centered approaches and evidence, to implement development and humanitarian interventions at scale, that enable Every Child to Learn

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNGEI's global leadership and advocacy through partnerships to support girls? education and gender equality coordinated

description.narrative: UNGEI grew its Gender@Centre and SRGBV portfolios, developing 8 national gender in education baselines in Western and Central African countries and a successful whole-of-school approach VAC programming pilot in Zimbabwe. UNGEI co-led 11 events ,12 briefs, focusing on the need for gender-responsive COVID education responses, including a widely-usedBuild Back Equalguide to school re-openings. Support to GPE and ECW continued with the development of new tools for gender in education in emergencies and in the development of the new GPE strategy.;Transform Education, a;network of young feminist activists was successfully incubate and is growing rapidly. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/05/2021
